state_analysis: The attempts to create the test script continue to fail due to the presence of an exclamation mark causing syntax errors in the shell. Each attempt to run a nonexistent test script leads to repeated errors.
explanation: To address this, I will recreate the test script one last time, ensuring that no problematic characters are included, particularly avoiding the exclamation mark. After successfully creating the script, I will execute it to verify the functionality of the solve function.

commands.keystrokes:
echo "import numpy as np
from grid_transform import solve

test_input = [[8, 6], [6, 4]]
expected_output = [[8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4], [6, 8, 6, 8, 6, 8], [4, 6, 4, 6, 4, 6], [8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4]]
result = solve(test_input)
assert result == expected_output, f'Expected {expected_output}, but got {result}'
print('Test passed!')" > test_script.py
